content.title: SEBI ITD Internship Program
content.details: The SEBI ITD Internship Program provides hands-on training to the students of the institutes based in and around Mumbai. The program accepts up to 15 interns. The Interns accepted under this program would be given an opportunity to work on different Information Technology (IT) projects including Data Analytics (DA), regulatory business processes and reporting, and FinTech at SEBI. Such projects will provide an exceptional opportunity to the interns to apply their IT and DA skills while gaining valuable exposure to the functioning of the Indian capital markets.
benefits: Stipend for interns working 3 days in a week: ₹25,000
Stipend for interns working 4 days in a week: ₹30,000
Leaves for interns working 3 days in a week: 9
Leaves for interns working 4 days in a week: 12
Unfurnished shared accommodation only for outstation candidates, subject to availability
Certificate of completion of internship program by SEBI
Public holidays as observed by SEBI
eligibility: The applicant should be a student pursuing a full-time MBA/MCA or equivalent degree or diploma of a duration of two years from an eligible institute.
The applicant should hold a full-time graduate degree in engineering or a BCA degree.
The applicant should have a strong aptitude for computer programming and data analytics.
The applicant should have a minimum 60% aggregate marks at graduate level or equivalent CGPA.
The age of the applicant should not be more than 30 years as on 1st January of the respective year.
The applicant should be an Indian citizen.
A basic understanding of financial markets is desirable but not mandatory.
content.application_process: Offline. The eligible institutes may express their interest to participate in SEBI ITD Internship Program in the prescribed format along with the relevant enclosures on or before January 20, 2020.
documents_required: Profile of the interested eligible candidates in the prescribed format (Annexure 2)

faqs.question: How Many Interns Does The SEBI ITD Internship Program Accept?
faqs.answer: The program accepts up to 15 interns.

faqs.question: What Kind Of Projects Will The Interns Work On During The Program?
faqs.answer: The interns will work on different Information Technology (IT) projects, including Data Analytics (DA), regulatory business processes and reporting, and FinTech at SEBI.

faqs.question: What Is The Duration Of The Internship Program?
faqs.answer: The internship program is proposed to be for a contiguous period of minimum 1 year, which may comprise of either 2 semesters and 1 summer/winter internship or 3 trimesters and 1 summer/winter internship.

faqs.question: What Is The Schedule For The Internship At SEBI?
faqs.answer: Interns are expected to intern at SEBI for at least 3 days a week, excluding Saturdays, Sundays, and Public Holidays.

faqs.question: Who Is Eligible To Apply For The SEBI ITD Internship Program?
faqs.answer: Candidates pursuing a full-time MBA/MCA or equivalent degree or diploma of a duration of two years, holding a full-time graduate degree in engineering or a BCA degree, having a strong aptitude for computer programming and data analytics, and with a minimum of 60% aggregate marks at the graduate level or equivalent CGPA are eligible to apply.

faqs.question: Is A Basic Understanding Of Financial Markets Mandatory For Applicants?
faqs.answer: No, a basic understanding of financial markets is desirable but not mandatory.

faqs.question: What Facilities Are Provided To Interns During The Internship Program?
faqs.answer: Interns undergoing internship at SEBI for 3 days a week receive a monthly stipend of ₹25,000, and interns undergoing internship for 4 days a week receive a monthly stipend of ₹30,000. Interns are entitled to a certain number of leaves per year. Outstation candidates may be provided with unfurnished shared accommodation, subject to availability. Lunch at the SEBI office is provided, and interns receive a certificate of completion of the internship program.

faqs.question: What Documents Need To Be Submitted By Eligible Institutes To Express Their Interest In Participating In The SEBI ITD Internship Program?
faqs.answer: Eligible institutes need to express their interest by submitting the prescribed format along with the relevant enclosures.

faqs.question: Where Should All Correspondences Be Addressed?
faqs.answer: All correspondences should be addressed to the Chief General Manager, Information Technology Department, SEBI Bhavan, C4-A, G Block, Bandra Kurla Complex, Bandra (East), Mumbai - 400051, Maharashtra, India.
